report_title: Heating & Air-Conditioning Contractors in the US
executive_summary: Having seen slight growth through the end of 2024, revenue for the heating and air-conditioning contractors industry is influenced by changes in per capita disposable income, interest rates, consumer spending and a host of other drivers. HVAC contractors operate a steady business thanks to the necessity of their services and regular repair and maintenance work. Government support, including Qualified Improvement Property (QIP) tax write-offs, has aided revenue growth.

current_performance.current_performance_point_title: Heating and Air-Conditioning is a Necessity for Many
current_performance.current_performance_point_description: Heating, ventilation and air-conditioning (HVAC) systems must be repaired after years of use, as maintaining a comfortable temperature is essential for households and businesses to live and work effectively in the United States. Consumers, businesses and other customers must spend on maintenance whenever their systems malfunction, even during a recession.

current_performance.current_performance_point_title: Aid From the Federal Government Has Buoyed Spending on HVAC Contractors
current_performance.current_performance_point_description: Many heating and air-conditioning contractors were eligible for Paycheck Protection Program (PPP) loans to pay for lost wages and rent because of poor performance during the pandemic. Qualified Improvement Property (QIP) tax write-offs enabled owners of nonresidential structures to deduct the costs of improving their structures on their taxes. These write-offs make HVAC installation less expensive, keeping demand for the industry's services artificially high amid economic turmoil.

current_performance.current_performance_point_title: Rising Interest Rates Have Threatened the Residential Sector
current_performance.current_performance_point_description: Record-low interest rates during COVID-19 enabled consumers to buy new homes and improve their residences, leading to an expansion in HVAC installation from the residential sector. This dynamic particularly drove growth in 2021. Beginning in 2022, in response to rising inflation, the Federal Reserve has either hiked or held interest rates steady, driving up mortgage rates and driving down residential construction activity. The Federal Reserve is expected to begin to cut rates in 2024, however.

current_performance.current_performance_point_title: New Standards Have Made Installation More Costly
current_performance.current_performance_point_description: In 2023, the Department of Energy raised the seasonal energy efficiency (SEER) ratio, which is the ratio of output by air conditioners and heating pumps divided by energy use.

future_outlook.future_outlook_point_title: Gradual Interest Rate Cuts and Macroeconomic Expansion Will Turn Up the Heat
future_outlook.future_outlook_point_description: With the Federal Reserve expected to begin to cut rates in 2024, it is likely that, over the next five years, interest rates will continue to gradually fall from their current highs. Still, they will not likely reach pandemic lows. Lower interest rates will lower the cost of capital and broadly encourage investment.

future_outlook.future_outlook_point_title: Investment in Environmentally Sustainable Technologies Will Provide Opportunities for the Industry
future_outlook.future_outlook_point_description: Newer generations are concerned about climate change, so heating, air-conditioning and refrigeration companies will seek to invent environmentally sustainable products to appeal to younger people.

future_outlook.future_outlook_point_title: The Inflation Reduction Act Will Spur Growth
future_outlook.future_outlook_point_description: The Inflation Reduction Act was passed in 2022 and provides tax credits for households installing new or upgraded energy-efficient heat pumps.

future_outlook.future_outlook_point_title: Continued Maintenance and Replacement of Legacy Products
future_outlook.future_outlook_point_description: The perpetual need to maintain and replace existing HVAC systems will continue to buoy the industry regardless of economic troubles.

industry_definition: Heating and air-conditioning contractors in the United States install and service heating, ventilation, air-conditioning (HVAC) and refrigeration equipment. Companies perform new installations, additions, alterations, maintenance and repairs.
key_trends: Start-up costs are low for HVAC contractors. The ease of entry leads to a high concentration of smaller companies and stiff competition in local markets.
Consolidation differs depending on the market segment.
Climate change is driving up HVAC demand.
High interest rates have hindered growth.
The largest contractors offer various services.

market_segmentation.segment_description: The Housing Market Determines the Strength of New and Existing Residential Construction
The Housing Market Determines the Strength of New and Existing Residential Construction
Manufacturing Output Influences HVAC Spending on Industrial Buildings
The Move to At-Home Work Has Hindered Heating and Air-Conditioning Installations in Office Buildings
Private Nonresidential Construction is the Main Driver for HVAC Installations in Commercial Buildings
FEWER COLLEGE STUDENTS THREATEN HVAC CONTRACTORS THAT WORK ON EDUCATIONAL FACILITIES
COVID-19 HIKED FUNDING FROM MISCELLANEOUS MARKETS

products_and_services.product_description: New homes require new heating, ventilation and air conditioning (HVAC) installations, so housing starts and the value of residential construction have the most influence on this segment.
Construction on existing HVAC systems often occurs in nonresidential buildings.
The maintenance of HVAC systems occurs when existing installations need repair.

products_and_services.product_or_service: REFRIGERATION SYSTEM INSTALLATIONS, MAINTENANCE AND REPAIRS
products_and_services.product_description: Restaurants, catering halls, hospitals and other businesses need refrigeration systems to keep food and other products cool.

tier_1_suppliers: Plumbing & Heating Supplies Wholesaling in the US
Heating & Air Conditioning Wholesaling in the US
Refrigeration Equipment Wholesaling in the US

demand_determinants.determinant_description: Private investment in nonresidential structures consists of new construction and renovations.

business_locations.location_description: The Southeast experiences a warm and humid climate for much of the year.
The Great Lakes region is home to cities such as Chicago, Detroit and Cleveland.
The Mid-Atlantic is home to some of the largest cities in the United States.
Diverse climates in the Western region demand robust heating and air-conditioning solutions.

regulations_points.regulation_description: In many states, heating and air-conditioning contractors are subject to regulations requiring extensive education and training.

regulations_points.regulation_title: THE COMPREHENSIVE ENVIRONMENTAL RESPONSE, COMPENSATION AND LIABILITY ACT (CERCLA) OF 1980
regulations_points.regulation_description: CERCLA permits the federal government to tax or charge companies that emit hazardous materials.

basis_points.basis_description: Start-up costs are low for HVAC contractors.

concentration_points.concentration_description: Easy entry leads to high concentration of small companies.

cost_factors.cost_factor_title: Limited Use of Equipment Keep Depreciation Costs Low
cost_factors.cost_factor_description: Depreciation costs arise when worker vans or storage facilities are worn out.

volatility_points.volatility_title: THE CONSISTENT NEED FOR MAINTENANCE SIGNIFICANTLY REDUCES VOLATILITY
volatility_points.volatility_description: Heating and air-conditioning systems must be repaired when they malfunction.

technological_change_points.technological_change_title: NEW HVAC INSTALLATION SYSTEMS SPECIALIZE IN PREVENTIVE MAINTENANCE
technological_change_points.technological_change_description: New HVAC installation systems prevent problems.

FAQs.question: Does your company primarily work with residential or nonresidential construction markets?
FAQs.answer: Most work is done in the nonresidential market.

FAQs.question: Are you solely focused on new work, or do you participate in remodeling activities?
FAQs.answer: Most work is derived from existing structures.
